class.name: MidiOut
class.brief_description: Sends MIDI output to hardware and software MIDI ports.
class.description:
[MidiOut] provides real-time MIDI output functionality using RtMidi. It lets you open physical MIDI ports or create virtual MIDI ports to send MIDI messages to synthesizers, DAWs, and other MIDI-capable software.
Use the static methods [method get_port_names] and [method get_port_count] to discover available MIDI output ports before opening a connection. Messages are sent immediately via [method send_message] once a port is open.

method.name: open_port
method.description: Opens a MIDI output port by its index number. Port indices are zero-based and can be determined using [method get_port_names] or [method get_port_count].

method.name: open_virtual_port
method.description: Creates and opens a virtual MIDI output port with the specified name. Other applications can connect to this port to receive MIDI messages you send. The port name is shown in the MIDI port lists of other applications.

method.name: close_port
method.description: Closes the currently open MIDI output port. After closing, open another port before sending additional MIDI messages.

method.name: is_port_open
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if a MIDI output port is currently open, [code]false[/code] otherwise.

method.name: get_port_count
method.description: Returns the number of available MIDI output ports on the system.

method.name: get_port_name
method.description: Returns the name of the MIDI output port at the specified index. Returns an empty string if the port index is invalid.

method.name: get_port_names
method.description: Returns an array containing the names of all available MIDI output ports on the system.

method.name: send_message
method.description: Sends a raw MIDI message. The [param message] should contain the complete MIDI packet (e.g. status byte and data bytes). If the array is empty, the call is ignored. Ensure a port is open before calling.

signal.name: midi_error
signal.description: Emitted when a MIDI-related error occurs. [param error_type] is one of the [enum MidiError] constants, and [param error_message] is a human-readable description.
